other_tests.findings: Superficial mild lymphohistiocytic perivascular infiltrate, with rare eosinophils and minimal papillary edema, consistent with nonspecific superficial lymphohistiocytic dermatitis.
Granular IgG and C3 at the dermoepidermal junction and IgG in a speckled nuclear pattern in the keratinocytes, consistent with lupus erythematosus.
Negative for IgA and IgG basement membrane zone antibodies.
